Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: with a very thin blade. It has three large binding-holes, which are unevenly spaced and badly misaligned. The holes were roughly drilled. The axe has been cleaned of corrosion product, and is in good condition. There are a number of small cracks around the central hole. The cutting end was shaped by hammering and grinding but was not fully sharpened. There are no signs of wear.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (54)
